```{r setup, includeFALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

```{r}
load('data/rawdata1.Rdata')
```


```{r}
rawdata2 <- rawdata1 %>%
  rowwise() %>% 
  mutate(sex = ifelse(gender == 'Male', 1, 
                                      ifelse(gender == 'Female', 2, NA)),
                                age_in_month = age * 12)
```

```{r}
summary(rawdata2$sex)
```


```{r}
descr(rawdata2, round.digits = 4, var = c(bmi))
```

```{r}
BMI_cutoff_matrix <- as.matrix(BMI_cutoff)
```

```{r}
head(BMI_cutoff_matrix )
```

how to combine null with non-null data?
SAS and R use different strategy when no condition is met SAS return missing while R return NULL
which is not compatible with other data type
```{r}
## problematic logic
f <- function(sex, age_in_month, bmi){
  # for month > 240 if they don't have information about bmi and age_in_month then set as missing
  if (is.na(bmi) || is.na(age_in_month)) {
    return(NA)
  }
  
  
  # classify BMI category for age > 240 month
  if (age_in_month >= 240) {
    if (bmi > 0 && bmi < 18.5){
      return('a:underweight')
    }
    else if (bmi >= 18.5 && bmi < 25) {
      return('b:normal')
    }
    else if (bmi >= 25 && bmi < 30) {
      return('c:overweight')
    }
    else if (bmi >= 30){
      return('d:obese')
    }
  }
  # the SAS code jump over 240 
  else if (age_in_month < 240) {
    if(is.na(sex)) {
      return(NA)
    }
    # classify BMI category for age <= 240 month
    for (group in 1:nrow(BMI_cutoff_matrix)) {
      if (age_in_month >= BMI_cutoff_matrix[group, 'month_lower_limit'] &&
          age_in_month < BMI_cutoff_matrix[group, 'month_upper_limit']  && sex == BMI_cutoff_matrix[group, 'sex']) {
            if (bmi > 0 && bmi <= BMI_cutoff_matrix[group, 'P5']) {
              return('a:underweight')
            }
            else if (bmi > BMI_cutoff_matrix[group, 'P5'] && bmi <= BMI_cutoff_matrix[group, 'P85']) {
              return('b:normal')
            }
            else if (bmi > BMI_cutoff_matrix[group, 'P85'] && bmi <= BMI_cutoff_matrix[group, 'P95']) {
              return('c:overweight')
            }
            else if (bmi > BMI_cutoff_matrix[group, 'P95']) {
              return('d:obese')
            }
      }
    }
  }
  
  # if none of those condition is satisfied then return missing
  return(NA)  
}
  
```



```{r}
rawdata2 <- rawdata2 %>% 
  rowwise() %>%  
  mutate(obese_overweight = f(sex, age_in_month, bmi))
```

```{r}
# if obese_overweight="d:obese" then do; obesity="Yes";obesity01=1; end;
# else if obese_overweight~="" then do; obesity="No";obesity01=0; end;
# 
# if obese_overweight in ("d:obese","c:overweight") then do; overweight="Yes";overweight01=1; end;
# else if obese_overweight~="" then do; overweight="No";overweight01=0; end;
#  
# run;


# create binary outcome variable of overweight
rawdata2 <- rawdata2 %>% 
  rowwise() %>% 
  mutate(obesity01 = ifelse(is.na(obese_overweight), NA, 
                           ifelse(obese_overweight == 'd:obese', 1, 0)),
         overweight = ifelse(is.na(obese_overweight), NA,
                               ifelse(obese_overweight %in% c("d:obese","c:overweight"), 'Yes', 'No')),
         overweight01 = ifelse(is.na(obese_overweight), NA,
                               ifelse(obese_overweight %in% c("d:obese","c:overweight"), 1, 0))
        )
```
